title: 820-00850 - 5v / 0,25a
message:
Board had a short on the CB308, the UB300 a little burned. I replaced both, but the problem remains.

PPBUS_G3H - 12.3v
3v3_G3H_RTC - 3.3v

I have no voltages on the AWAKE and SLPS2R lines of the U7800.

It is recognized in DFU mode, I tried to revive and restore, both give errors.

title: 820-00850 - 5v / 0,25a
message:
LDO lines in diode mode. All the same.

1.8 - 0.470
3v3 - 0.496
1.1 - 0.510
1.8 - 0.511

title: 820-00850 - 5v / 0,25a
message:
All ports have the same behavior?
Do you get 1V1 LDO on every CD3215 chip?

title: 820-00850 - 5v / 0,25a
message:
Yes, all ports behave the same.

I have 1.1v on all CD3215's. This line only has voltage on the connected port, correct?

title: 820-00850 - 5v / 0,25a
message: None of the coils around U7800 has voltage?

title: 820-00850 - 5v / 0,25a
message:
Strange, I went to measure, now I have tension.

PP1V1_SLPS2R : 1.1 Volt
PP1V8_SLPS2R : 1.8 Volt
PP0V8_SLPS2R : 0.7 Volt
PP1V2_AWAKE : 1.1 Volt
PP3V3_AWAKE : 3.3 Volt

title: 820-00850 - 5v / 0,25a
message:
Yeah, it shouldn't enter to DFU without these voltages.
I just wanted to confirm actual state.

What error do you get in DFU?
Any SSD, or G3S voltage tries to appear?

title: 820-00850 - 5v / 0,25a
message:
In DFU it stays a long time on "Installing system" and then the error:
Gave up waiting for device to transition from
DFU state to DFU state.
[com.apple.MobileDevice.MobileRestore -
OxFCA (4042)]

I have no voltage on SSD, PP1V8_SSD and PP0V9_SSD!

nothing on the G3S 3.3v and 1.8v line.

title: 820-00850 - 5v / 0,25a
message:
Be sure no short on any SSD, or G3S power rail.
I had a case when these voltages come on after several failed DFU attempts.

title: 820-00850 - 5v / 0,25a
message:
There are no shorts.

I will try to restore in DFU again.

title: 820-00850 - 5v / 0,25a
message:
I bought the S-UEM2 device and decided to go back to work on that abandoned mac.

It showed changes in some pins of the UB300 (31, 33, 40, 42), as it had already been changed, I tried to change it again.

[ATTACH type="full"]61176[/ATTACH]

title: 820-00850 - 5v / 0,25a
message: I connected the cable the wrong way. It didn't report any failures.

title: 820-00850 - 5v / 0,25a
message:
Reflash SoC ROM and try DFU again.
Don't forget to make backup first.
